item.title: Named Query Filters in EF 10 (multiple query filters per entity)
item.description: EF 10 introduces named query filters, allowing multiple filters on a single entity and letting you selectively disable specific filters without turning off all query filters. This article explains how the feature works, shows practical examples for combining soft deletion and multi-tenancy, highlights best practices like using constants for filter names, and explores where such fine-grained control is particularly useful. Link to article: https://www.milanjovanovic.tech/blog/named-query-filters-in-ef-10-multiple-query-filters-per-entity
